chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
These are the words of Amos, one of the shepherds of Tekoa, which he received about Israel during the days of Uzziah, king of Judah, and Jeroboam, son of Joash, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake. Amos means "a people carried away." Uzziah means "the power or strength of the Lord." Jeroboam means "indictment or cause of the people." Joash means "the Lord's memory or temporality." Tekoa, which means "trumpet," signifies the prophecies of the prophets. And he said, "The Lord will roar from Zion and raise his voice from Jerusalem. The beautiful places of the shepherds will mourn, and the top of Carmel will dry up." From Jerusalem, where the temple and God's religion resided, where Christ arose, like a lion, through the preaching of the Gospel, he raised his voice. The beautiful places of the shepherds represent the people of the Jews. The top of Carmel symbolizes the temple, kingdom, or priesthood of the Jews.

This is what the Lord says: "For three crimes of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, because they have threshed Gilead with iron sledges. I will send fire upon the house of Hazael, and it will devour the palaces of Ben-Hadad." The three and four crimes of the nations, which are repeatedly mentioned, are these: The first crime is that all die in Adam. The second is that, forgetful of reason by the innate law of nature, they did not understand. The third is that those who were given the law did not obey it. The fourth is the refusal of those who did not believe in Christ. After listing the crimes of the nations, Judah is accused in the seventh place of breaking the law, and Israel in the eighth place for their impiety towards Christ. Alternatively, the three and four crimes can be seen as thinking, consenting, acting, and not repenting; or thinking, speaking, acting, and defending one's sin. The first sin is to have thought what is evil, the second is to have agreed with those thoughts, the third is to have acted upon them, and the fourth is not to have repented afterwards.

Hazael means "work of God." "I will break the bar of Damascus, cut off the inhabitant from the Valley of Idolatry, and remove the one who holds the scepter from the house of pleasure. The people of Syria will go into exile to Kir," says the Lord.
chunks.original_latin:
Verba Amos, qui fuit in pastoralibus de Thecua,
quae vidit super Israel in diebus Oziae regis Juda, et
in diebus Hieroboam, filii Joas regis Israel, ante
duos annos terraemotus. Amos interpretatur populus
avulsus, Ozias vero imperium, vel fortitudo Domini,
Hieroboam autem indicatio, vel causa populi, sive
divisio populi, Joas Domini memoria, sive temporalitas. Thecue vero, quae interpretatur tuba, vaticinia
significat prophetarum. Et dixit, Dominus de Sion rugiet, et de Hierusalem
dabit vocem suam. Et luxerunt speciosa pastorum,
et exsiccatus est vertex Carmeli. De Hierusalem,
ubi erat templum et Dei religio, unde
Christus ortus velut leo per Evangelicam praedicationem
dedit vocem. Speciosa pastorum, populus
Judaeorum, vertex Carmeli, templum seu regnum,
vel sacerdotium Judaeorum. Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Damasci,
et super quatuor non convertam eum, eo
quod contriverit in plaustris ferreis Galaad. Et mittam
ignem in domo Chazael, et devorabit Dominus
Benadab. Tria et quatuor scelera gentium, quae
series replicat, haec sunt: Primum itaque scelus est,
 quia omnes in Adam moriuntur. Secundum pro eo
quod insita naturae lege immemores rationis non
intellexerunt. Tertium quoque eorum, qui datae legi
non obediunt. Quartum inexpugnabile eorum qui
 in Christum non crediderunt. Post scelera vero gentium,
septimo in loco Juda de praevaricatione legis,
et octavo Israel de impietate, quam in Christo exercuerunt,
redarguit. Vel certe tria et quatuor scelera
sunt cogitare, consentire, facere, et non poenitere:
aut certe cogitare, loqui, agere, et peccatum suum
defendere. Primum peccatum est cogitasse quod malum
est, secundo cogitationibus acquievisse, tertio
opere perpetrasse: quartum, post peccatum suum
poenitentiam non egisse. Chazael interpretatur factura
Dei. Et conteram vectem Damasci, et disperdam habitatorem
de campo idoli, et tenentem sceptrum de
domo voluptatis, et transferetur populus Syriae in
Cirenem, dicit Dominus.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
Damascus means "drinking blood" or "approving blood," a symbol of this world. This is what the Lord says: For three crimes of Gaza, and for four, I will not turn back, because they took away an entire captivity to deliver them up to Edom. I will send fire upon the walls of Gaza, and it will consume its palaces. I will destroy the inhabitants of Ashdod and the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon. I will turn my hand against Ekron, and the remaining Philistines will perish, says the Lord God.

Gaza means "his strength." This is what the Lord says: For three crimes of Tyre, and for four, I will not turn back, because they delivered an entire captivity to Edom and did not remember the covenant of brothers. Tyre means "tribulation" or "narrowing." It represents the doctrines of heretics, which try to capture the truth and confine it to earthly senses. I will send fire upon the walls of Tyre, and it will consume its palaces. The fire seems to signify the impiety of heretics, which devours their gatherings, like walls or houses, that is, their consciences. It may also signify future damnation.

This is what the Lord says: For three crimes of Edom, and for four, I will not turn back, because he pursued his brother with the sword and violated his mercy, holding onto his fury and keeping his indignation forever. Edom, which means "red" or "earthly," represents the people of the Jews and heretics persecuting their brother, that is, Christ in his members. I will send fire upon Teman, and it will consume the palaces of Bozrah. The Lord will send fire upon Teman, that is, in the dry and barren Judah, so that with all literal sense collapsing, the Church of Christ the Lord may be built upon foundations.

This is what the Lord says: For three crimes of the children of Ammon, and for four, I will not turn back, because they ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead to enlarge their border.
chunks.original_latin:
Damascus interpretatur
 sanguinem bibens, sive sanguinem probans, figura
hujus mundi. Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus
Gazae, et super quatuor non convertam eum, eo quod
transtulerint captivitatem perfectam, ut concluderent
eam in Idumaeam, et mittam ignem in murum Gazae,
et devorabit aedes ejus, et disperdam habitatorem de
Azoto, et tenentem sceptrum de Ascalone. Et convertam
manum meam super Accaron, et peribunt
reliqui Philistinorum, dicit Dominus Deus. Gaza
interpretatur fortitudo ejus. Haec dicit Dominus:
Super tribus sceleribus Tyri et super quatuor non
convertam eum, eo quod concluserint captivitatem
perfectam in Idumaea, et non sint recordati foederis
 fratrum. Tyrus interpretatur tribulatio sive coangustans. Significat perversae doctrinae haereticorum
dogmata, quae capere nititur veritatem, et concludere
eam in terrenis sensibus. Et mittam ignem in murum Tyri, et devorabit
aedes ejus. Ignem haereticorum impietatem significare
videtur, quae eorum significat congregationes,
velut murum sive aedes, id est conscientias eorum
devorat. Potest et futuram significare damnationem. Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus
Edom, et super quatuor non convertam eum, eo
quod persecutus sit in gladio fratrem suum, et violaverit
misericordiam ejus, et tenuerit ultra furorem
suum, et indignationem suam servaverit usque in
finem. Edom, qui interpretatur sanguineus sive
 terrenus, significat populum Judaeorum et haereticos
persequentes fratrem suum, hoc est Christum in
membris suis. Mittam ignem in Theman, et devorabit aedes
Bosrae. Mittet Dominus ignem in Theman, hoc est
in deserta siccaque Judaea, ut omni sensu litterae
concidente, superaedificetur Ecclesia Christi Domini
fundamentis. Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus filiorum
Ammon, et super quatuor non convertam eum,
eo quod dissecuerit praegnantes Galaad, ad dilatandum
terminum suum.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
And I will set fire to the wall of Rabbah, and it will consume her houses amid wailing on the day of battle, and in the storm on the day of upheaval. And Melchom will go into captivity, he and his princes together, says the Lord.

Gilead, for instance, is interpreted as a heap of testimony. Because the whole congregation of the Church serves as a testimony to the truth through confession, it is fitting that the Church is represented by Gilead, which testifies to the truths of God through the actions of all the faithful.

The souls that conceive the understanding of the Word from divine love are called pregnant, as they will give birth to the conceived understanding through the demonstration of their works when they reach the perfect time. Therefore, the heretics cut open the pregnant women of Gilead to expand their own territory, because they destroy the minds of the faithful, who already perceive some understanding of the truth, through perverse preaching. They extend the name of knowledge to themselves while they tear apart the hearts of the little ones, already pregnant with the conception of the Word, with the sword of error, and make a reputation for themselves as if they were teachers.
chunks.original_latin:
Et succendam ignem in murum
Rabah, et devorabit aedes ejus in ululatu in die belli,
et in turbine in die commotionis. Et ibit Melchom in
captivitatem, ipse et principes ejus simul, dicit Dominus. Galaad namque acervus testimonii interpretatur. Et quia cuncta simul congregatio Ecclesiae
per confessionem servit testimonio veritatis, non
incongrue per Galaad Ecclesia exprimitur, quae opere
cunctorum fidelium de Deo quae sunt vera testantur. Praegnantes autem vocantur animae quae intellectum
Verbi ex divino amore concipiunt, si ad perfectum
tempus veniant, conceptam intelligentiam operis
ostensione pariturae. Secuerunt ergo praegnantes Galaad
haeretici ad dilatandum terminum suum, quia
nimirum mentes fidelium, quae jam aliquid de veritatis
intellectu percipiunt, perversa praedicatione
perimunt, et scientiae sibi nomen extendunt, dum
parvulorum corda jam de Verbi conceptione gravida,
erroris gladio scindunt, et quasi doctrinae sibi opinionem
 faciunt.
